extendedInfo.description: Are you sick and tired of boring workouts that fail to deliver results? Well Decked! Challenge is just what you've been searching for.****************WHAT'S NEW:****************â¥â¥â¥ WORKOUT LEADERBOARDS â¥â¥â¥World Wide Rankings!! Have you got what it takes to complete a workout the fastest and become the #1 Decked Challenge Champion?â¦â¦â¦ ACHIEVEMENTS â¦â¦â¦Complete workouts and unlock cool new achievements... Can you unlock them all?â£â£â£ NEW EXERCISES â£â£â£Awesome new exercises for all levels.****************FEATURES:- 8 pre-made workouts with different difficulty levels (more workouts to come),- Ability to create custom workouts utilizing the in-built exercise library,- Numerous exercises (with tutorials) focused on using only your body weight as resistance,- Helpful regressions and progressions for each exercise, - No equipment required,- CrossFit orientated training style,- Results and progress tracking (see your performance improve as you get fitter),- Share your achievements and challenge friends by posting your workout result to Facebook,- Personal Best (PB) tracking for pre-made workouts,- Body statistics,- Helpful exercise and well-being tips,- App to SD.**********With Decked! Challenge no two workouts are ever the same, ensuring your body/muscles are always guessing and youâre entertained. These continual variations in stimuli should also help prevent those plateaus in results that can be so frustrating. In addition, each workout is specifically structured to provide balanced results.And the great news... Absolutely NO EQUIPMENT IS REQUIRED! All you need is a little bit of floor space and some enthusiasm.So, how does it work?Decked! Challenge (Bodyweight) is a workout based around a deck of cards, randomly drawn.Each suit of the deck represents a particular exercise (e.g. Spades may be Squats) and the value of the card determines the number of repetitions (e.g. 7 of Spades would mean you need to perform 7 Squats).There are a few more rules however to keep things interesting...- Picture cards count as 10 repetitions, and- Jokers count as 10 repetitions of all 4 suit exercises (to be performed consecutively).Decked! Challenge also allows for progressive development. You can specify the difficulty of the workout by choosing the type of deck you want to use:- Beginner = No picture cards and only 1 Joker (41 cards total).- Intermediate = Full deck but only 1 Joker (53 cards total).- Advanced = Full deck and 2 Jokers (54 cards total).Donât be concerned if you canât complete the full deck of cards on your first try. These workouts are designed to be challenging, but with commitment and perseverance you will soon see your workout time decrease and the number of cards completed in a session increase!The goal in Decked! Challenge is to compete against yourself (and your friends) in an effort to beat your Personal Best for a given workout. At the end of your workout why not challenge your friends to see whoâs Decked!. Challenge friends by posting results to your Facebook page or the Decked! Challenge Facebook page and become a DECKED! CHALLENGE CHAMPION.So now the only question is... HAVE YOU GOT WHAT IT TAKES TO GET DECKED!?TagsCrossFit xfit Workout Fitness Playing Cards Card Exercise Pushup Situp sit up push up push-up sit-up Deck of Cards Facebook crunch crunches Decked! reviews.title: No arm exercises!!!
reviews.comment: ...we should be able to add our own exercises because the selection is so limited! All there is for the upper body is push ups (chest), sit ups (abs), and superman (low back). There is a push up variation that will get the shoulders, but where are the biceps and triceps?
reviews.author: Amber Richter

reviews.title: Excellent workout
reviews.comment: Just tried this app and it works well.  It does give you a good workout and explains the exercises well.
reviews.author: adam goodman

reviews.title: What a great app for at home
reviews.comment: This is the perfect app if you have no time for the gym.  I am a personal trainer and it had tested me!
reviews.author: Matthew Ransom

reviews.title: worth it
reviews.comment: so many apps out there I say commit some time give it a go you\'ll be pleasantly surprised
reviews.author: Ozan Aytac

reviews.title: Keeps you guessing
reviews.comment: So hard but fun and the exercises aren\'t in order so very good. Easy to use as well.  Awesome
reviews.author: Adam Miller

reviews.title: Reallllly like it but...
reviews.comment: This is a great app!  Couldn\'t ask for a better one,  however I wish there was the feature to add in your own excersizes.  The fact that you can\'t do that is a huge bummer.  Please fix!!
reviews.author: Alexa a

reviews.title: Good app
reviews.comment: You will get tired good if your looking for sweat equity
reviews.author: John Dewberry

reviews.title: Great Replacement
reviews.comment: For Fitdeck....don\'t know what happened to that app but this one is a lot better!
reviews.author: A Google User

reviews.title: Great App!!!
reviews.comment: There are many routines to choose from and gives you a real good workout. Great app worth the money.
reviews.author: A Google User

reviews.title: Amazing app!!!
reviews.comment: It\'s a real workout. Keeps the body guessing and all round loads of fun!! Great work
reviews.author: A Google User

reviews.title: Good workout
reviews.comment: This is a great workout. Its challenging but exciting too as you never know whats coming next! Good work dev!
reviews.author: A Google User

reviews.title: Best fitness app I\'ve seen in a long time
reviews.comment: Awesome app with great variation. I particularly like that no equipment is required and that you can create your own custom workout. Great work
reviews.author: A Google User

reviews.title: Great app
reviews.comment: Kept me guessing I wish there were more than the 4 exercises though....great app though
reviews.author: A Google User
